definition: a trace on a display screen (such as an oscilloscope), a spot on a radar screen
an interruption of the sound received in a radio or television program or occurring in a recording as a result of blipping
a transient sharp movement up or down (as of a quantity commonly shown on a graph)
something relatively small or inconsequential within a larger context
examples: made only a blip on the political scene

definition: to remove (recorded sound) from a recording so that there is an interruption of the sound in the reproduction
examples: a censor blipped the swear words
